Did you have a default JVM defined at the time?  Did you have other JVMs?  The error came from a call to get the default JVM's name.

Hi Brian,

That was indeed the issue. I'm downgrading to "normal", though of course a more helpful message/intervention should be provided.

Default JREs were assigned in launching environment. Howerver, in runtime environment, while "installed JREs" indicated 1.5.0, when I clicked on the "Execution Environment" tab, all of the mappings from J2SExxx to 1.5.0 were not assigned. I had assumed that the JRE defaults were copied from the launching environment to the runtime environment. This occurs for new runtime configurations as well. I am launching from a recent install with all plugins from either Eclipse project update sties or Subeclipse. Any ideas about why this might happen? Should I open a seperate report?

Not having the JRE checked in the EE section is perfectly normal.  

When you say launching environment and runtime environment, you are talking about a host and an Eclipse Runtime Workbench?

Yes, sorry.. For background please see bug 206234, but basically I'm trying to arrive at a Runtime environment that simply provides equivalent functionality of my install + the PDE plugins I'm developing within it. I was starting with the full set of workspace plugins but because of last issue reported there I am now trying the minimal set needed to support my plugins.

My issue with EE is why is my JVM selection for J2SE not being propogated to target Runtime -- is that normal?
This may be a Mac platform issue..for some reason my Eclipse Runtime can not find my platform JDK..
Curtis, could you look into this and try to find a way to gracefully deal with a scenario where null is returned when we query for the default JVM.  If you need help, please let me know.
